epfl.lia.logist.task
Class TaskManager

java.lang.Object
  epfl.lia.logist.task.TaskManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
IService, IAgentListener, ITopologyListener
public class TaskManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements IService, IAgentListener, ITopologyListener

The task manager implements management of tasks The task manager in the LogistPlatform application entirely takes care of the management of tasks. Agents do not carry tasks, instead, they ask allocation of tasks, and then, the task manager internally displaces the requested task(if available) to the task list corresponding to the list of tasks owned by a particular agent.

Method Detail

dispatchTasks

protected void dispatchTasks(java.util.ArrayList<Task> tasks)
This method dispatches a given list of tasks through the city. Note that this operation must not be interrupted, or the cities will have partial tasks.

Parameters:
tasks - An array of tasks to dispatch.

deliverTask

public double deliverTask(AID aid,
                          java.lang.String agentName,
                          java.lang.Integer taskID)
Deliver the currently holded task This method allows delivering a particular task held by current agent.

Parameters:
aid - the id of the agent having a task to deliver
Returns:
the reward per km associated to this task

releaseTasks

public void releaseTasks(AID agentID)
Release tasks for a particular agent This method releases the list of tasks actually owned by a particular agent. This method is important, since when an agent blocks, it can hold some tasks. These tasks must return to the system.

Parameters:
agentID - The ID of the agent for which we want to return tasks

getTaskList

public java.util.ArrayList<Task> getTaskList(boolean everything)
Return a list of all tasks in the system. This method returns the complete list of tasks in the system. It can return the list of tasks that have not been delivered, or the complete list. Tasks in this list are clones.

Parameters:
everything - indicates if even tasks which have been delivered should be added to the list
Returns:
a list of cloned tasks.

public boolean allTasksDelivered()
Indicates whether all tasks are delivered All tasks are delivered when there

generateMoreTasks

public void generateMoreTasks()
Generate more tasks in the taskset This method is invoked on every turn to generate more tasks. This function will fail when working with finite task sets, however, it will generate more tasks when working with infinite sets !
